review_blob: Very dark black-like mahogany with full on cappuccino head Aroma: Chocolate accented roasted malts and cream. Taste: Tastes cocoa / coffee and cream. Smooth roasted malts with a touch of coffee. Slight hoppy tang at the end. Palate: Low carbonation, smooth. Overall: Easy drinking session milk stout - a classic English Ale, well presented and worthy of its title of the best NZ handpull ale in 2012

Classic handpull ale, pours well with an honest head. A delicately hopped nose, giving way to warm malty happiness as the ale is beguilingly consumed. Thirst quenching - a true English ale and the ultimate session beer

Pours clear with orange glow, crisp white head. Beautifully clear aroma, tastes of citrus with strong malt backbone. Delicious and very drinkable  a session beer, but not for the faint hearted. The concept is clear - single malt and single hops - the result is outstanding
